availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Arnold (Louisville, Kentucky, student and soldier (11th KY Cav))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John C. Arnold and Sarah A. Arnold. Resident of Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Louisville in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and a corporal from September 22, 1862 to July 14, 1865. Captured in Blount County, Tennessee, on November 14, 1863. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia from December 1, 1863 to March 4, 1864. Prisoner of war at Andersonville Prison, in Sumter County, Georgia from March 1864 to March 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 127B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 306.
"Arnold, William T." Compiled Service Records of Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0105.
"William T. Arnold (unknown-1928)," Find A Grave, Memorial 3282364, accessed November 30, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3282364.
